component.name: Notesnook
component.summary: A fully open source & end-to-end encrypted note taking alternative to Evernote

description.p: Notesnook is a free (as in speech) & open source note taking app focused on user privacy & ease of use. To ensure zero knowledge principles, Notesnook encrypts everything on your device using XChaCha20-Poly1305 & Argon2.

Notesnook is our proof that privacy does not (always) have to come at the cost of convenience. Our goal is to provide users peace of mind & 100% confidence that their notes are safe and secure. Our decision to go fully open source is one of the most crucial steps towards that.

Notesnook is a user focused note taking tool meant to offer a fully end-to-end encrypted note taking experience for everyone. This includes the majority of our less tech savy users who just want to take notes without all the hassle.

In short, Notesnook aims to offer a complete replacement for other insecure note taking tools like Evernote & Notion. Because let's be honest, these tools offer great productivity but at a great cost to your privacy.

ul.li: Topics are now optional
Customizable trash cleanup interval
Tab/window title will now change based on the opened note
Arm64 support for Windows & Linux
Images are now much more stable
Fix autocomplete text color for all text inputs
Move cell properties button outside of table settings
Do a healthcheck before logging out user on session revoke
Fix issue where table options are not visible on some tables
Fix issue where dropdown required 2 clicks to open in editor toolbar
Simplify subscription cancellation
Fix monographs and reminders search
Keep marks when creating new list items in editor
Fix sub checklists not getting sorted
Attachments now automatically infer an extension based on mime type
App version can now be copied on clicking the version item in settings

A lot of improvements to code blocks:
Pasting from VSCode, GitHub, GitLab, MDN, Stackoverflow etc. will now automatically detect & highlight the code blocks
Typing inside a code block should now be much, much faster
Wrapping has been disabled for all lines in the code block

Many, many fixes to images:
Fix pasting of images from around another web page
Improve save performance of notes that have a lot of images in them
Improve image loading animation (there should be much less jank)
Fix sizing issues of images (and their placeholders) especially on small devices
All Notesnook clients now only load newly added images on realtime sync instead of loading all the images. This greatly speeds up sync.
Sortable task lists
Faster editor performance
New outline lists
Much smoother app startup experience
Fix issue where links were editable even in readonly mode
Fix vertical spacing between nested list items
Fix issue where Notebooks submenu is positioned incorrectly at the top
Editor performance improvements
Fix issue where extra whitespaces/tabs are not preserved in editor
Adjust horizontal rule's vertical spacing
Fix link colors in link hover popup
Fix issue where Enter key does not move cursor to newly created line on some keyboards in Android
Hide status bar in tablet mode
Fix issue where note context menu crashed due to incorrect topic references
Improve backspace handling with lists
Properly handle duplicate titled notes in bulk note exports
Hide backup reminder after backup has been downloaded
Fix issue where attached images wouldn't load after real time sync
Improve "Clear completed tasks" performance
Fix link popup not opening on link focus in mobile
Attachments can now be multi selected again in the "Manage attachments" dialog
